title: The Good Shepherd
subtitle: When Jesus declares He knows His sheep by name

key_verse.text: I am the good shepherd: the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep.

cards.title: The Shepherd in Israel
cards.subtitle: Why this image was so powerful for the Jewish audience
cards.content:
When Jesus says 'I am the good shepherd,' He's using one of the richest images from the Old Testament.

üèúÔ∏è THE CULTURAL CONTEXT:

‚Ä¢ Shepherding was the most common profession in Israel - everyone understood this image
‚Ä¢ Shepherds spent days and nights with their sheep in the wilderness
‚Ä¢ They knew each sheep by name and characteristics
‚Ä¢ Sheep recognized their specific shepherd's voice
‚Ä¢ The shepherd went BEFORE the flock, not behind - he led them, didn't drive them

üìñ THE OLD TESTAMENT IMAGE:

‚Ä¢ Psalm 23 begins: 'The LORD is my shepherd'
‚Ä¢ God calls Himself the Shepherd of Israel (Psalm 80:1, Ezekiel 34)
‚Ä¢ In Ezekiel 34, God promises: 'I myself will tend my sheep' (v.15)

‚ö° THE EXPLOSIVE CONNECTION:

When Jesus says 'I AM the good shepherd,' He's declaring: 'I am the LORD, the promised Shepherd from Ezekiel 34. I am God Himself coming to care for my sheep.'

For the Pharisees listening, this wasn't pretty poetry. It was a declaration of deity that made them pick up stones (John 10:31).
cards.revelation_key: Jesus didn't come to be a good religious teacher. He came to be the Shepherd that God promised to be for His people.

cards.title: Kal√≥s: Not Just Good, But Beautiful
cards.subtitle: The word describing the perfect shepherd

greek_words.meaning: Good, beautiful, noble, excellent in character and appearance
greek_words.revelation:
Jesus doesn't say 'agathos' (morally good). He says KAL√ìS - a shepherd who is:

‚Ä¢ Good in internal character
‚Ä¢ Beautiful in external appearance
‚Ä¢ Noble in behavior
‚Ä¢ Excellent in every aspect

It's the same word used in Genesis 1 (LXX) when God sees His creation and says 'kal√≥' (very good/beautiful).

Not just a shepherd who does his duty. The IDEAL, PERFECT, BEAUTIFUL shepherd in every sense.
greek_words.application: Your Shepherd isn't just morally good. He is completely beautiful, totally trustworthy, perfectly excellent in every way of caring for you.

greek_words.revelation:
The verb is in PRESENT tense and ACTIVE voice: 'is putting' his life.

It doesn't say 'was forced to give' or 'had his life taken.' It says 'PUTS' (tithƒìsin) - a completely voluntary act.

Jesus repeats this in v.18: 'No man taketh it from me, but I lay it down of myself.'

Not a victim. A VOLUNTARY, INTENTIONAL, CHOSEN sacrifice.
greek_words.application: Christ didn't die because He lost a battle. He died because He CHOSE to die for you. His death was the most voluntary act of love in history.

cards.revelation_key: The good shepherd doesn't just HAVE to care for you. He WANTS to care for you. His love isn't obligation; it's delight.

cards.title: I Know My Sheep
cards.subtitle: The personal intimacy of the Shepherd with each sheep
cards.content:
John 10:14-15 says: 'I am the good shepherd, and know my sheep, and am known of mine. As the Father knoweth me, even so know I the Father.'

üîë THREE LEVELS OF KNOWING:

1Ô∏è‚É£ 'I KNOW MY SHEEP':

‚Ä¢ The Greek word is 'gin≈çsk≈ç' - intimate, experiential knowledge
‚Ä¢ Not mental information; personal relationship
‚Ä¢ Jesus knows your name, your history, your wounds, your fears
‚Ä¢ Knows what you need before you ask

2Ô∏è‚É£ 'MINE KNOW ME':

‚Ä¢ The sheep RECOGNIZE the shepherd's voice (v.4-5)
‚Ä¢ Don't follow strangers because they don't know their voice
‚Ä¢ This knowledge is relational, not just informational
‚Ä¢ You can know ABOUT Jesus without KNOWING Jesus

3Ô∏è‚É£ THE DIVINE STANDARD:

'As the Father knoweth me, even so know I the Father' (v.15)

Jesus compares YOUR relationship with Him to HIS relationship with the Father:
‚Ä¢ The Father and Son have perfect intimacy
‚Ä¢ Perfect communication
‚Ä¢ Perfect union
‚Ä¢ And Jesus says THAT'S how He knows you!

‚ö†Ô∏è THE WARNING:

In Matthew 7:23, Jesus says to some: 'I never knew you.' Not 'I never knew about you.' Says 'I never KNEW you' (gin≈çsk≈ç).

Mutual knowledge is the essence of the gospel.

scripture_connections.text: The LORD is my shepherd... He maketh me to lie down in green pastures
I, even I, will both search my sheep, and seek them out
He calleth his own sheep by name, and leadeth them out

cards.revelation_key: You're not a number in a giant flock. You're known by name, loved personally, cared for individually by the Shepherd of the universe.

cards.title: I Am the Door of the Sheep
cards.subtitle: The exclusive access to the Father
cards.content:
In John 10:7-9, Jesus makes another radical declaration: 'I am the door of the sheep.'

üèïÔ∏è THE SHEEPFOLD IN JESUS'S TIME:

‚Ä¢ Sheepfolds were enclosed with stone walls
‚Ä¢ Had ONE single entrance/exit
‚Ä¢ The shepherd literally LAY DOWN in the entrance during the night
‚Ä¢ No wolf could enter without going over the shepherd
‚Ä¢ No sheep could leave without the shepherd knowing

üö™ 'I AM THE DOOR' (v.9):

Jesus DOESN'T say 'I am A door.' Says 'I am THE door.'

Means:
‚Ä¢ ONLY access to the Father ('No man cometh unto the Father, but by me' - John 14:6)
‚Ä¢ TOTAL security (the wolf must pass through the Shepherd first)
‚Ä¢ WATCHED freedom ('shall go in and out, and find pasture' - v.9)

üîí THE EXCLUSIVITY:

This offends modern culture, but Jesus is clear:
‚Ä¢ There aren't many paths to God
‚Ä¢ All religions don't lead to the same place
‚Ä¢ Jesus is the ONLY way, the ONLY door

'All that ever came before me are thieves and robbers' (v.8)

He's not insulting OT prophets. He's exposing false shepherds who promised salvation by any way other than Christ's sacrifice.

‚úùÔ∏è THE COST OF BEING THE DOOR:

To be the door, Jesus had to:
‚Ä¢ Put His body between the sheep and danger
‚Ä¢ Receive the attack meant for the sheep
‚Ä¢ Die so the sheep could enter safely

On the cross, Jesus literally became the door - His broken body is your entrance to the Father.

scripture_anchor.text: I am the door: by me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.

cards.revelation_key: You don't enter God's kingdom by being good, religious, or sincere. You enter through one door: Jesus Christ crucified and risen.

discovery_questions.question: Jesus says 'I know my sheep.' Do you live with the assurance that Jesus knows you PERSONALLY, by name, with all your struggles?
The sheep know the shepherd's voice. Can you distinguish Jesus's voice from other voices (culture, religion, your own mind) speaking in your life?
The shepherd puts down his life voluntarily for the sheep. Do you trust that Christ WANTS to care for you, not just that He HAS to?

prayer.title: Prayer to the Good Shepherd
prayer.content: Jesus, my Good Shepherd, my beautiful and perfect Shepherd. Thank You that I'm not a number in an anonymous flock. You know me by name. You know my wounds, my fears, my needs. Today I choose to listen to Your voice above all other voices. Thank You that You laid down Your life voluntarily for me. You weren't a victim; You were a sacrifice. You are the only door to the Father, and I enter with gratitude and confidence. Lead me to green pastures and still waters. Guide me in paths of righteousness for Your name's sake. Though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for You are with me. In the name of the Good Shepherd, Amen.
